title: Tuberville dipping into Montgomery for football talent
text:

Coached by former Auburn coach Tommy Tuberville, the Bearcats have offered Park Crossing Check out this story on montgomeryadvertiser.com: http://on.mgmadv.com/1RKpQlf Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Duane Rankin , Montgomery Advertiser 12:03 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 
Cincinnati coach Tommy Tuberville, who coached at Auburn, has offered scholarships to three Montgomery prep players. (Photo: USA TODAY Sports) 
Cincinnati is making a major move in Montgomery for talent. 
Coached by former Auburn coach Tommy Tuberville, the Bearcats have offered Park Crossing sophomore offensive lineman Marcus "Tank" Jenkins, St. James junior linebacker Sterling Jones and Lee junior receiver Henry Ruggs III. 
Rivals.com has Jenkins receiving others offers from Auburn, Florida, LSU, Florida State and Kentucky. Jones also has offers from Florida, Kentucky and Louisville. 
Ruggs III has additional offers from Florida, Mississippi State, Kentucky, Illinois and Georgia Southern. 
Cincinnati has two players on its current online roster from the state of Alabama -- sophomore offensive lineman Korey Robinson of Montevallo and redshirt freshman quarterback Hayden Moore of Clay-Chalkville. Congrats to Marcus"Tank"Jenkins on receiving an offer from the University of Cincinnati. #Bearcats #Madhousefit pic.twitter.com/5zKMY6kQpY — Madhouse Training (@Madhousefit) October 13, 2015 Congrats to Sterling Jones on receiving an offer from the University of Cincinnati. #Bearcats #Madhousefit pic.twitter.com/dPQaA7pWCA — Madhouse Training (@Madhousefit) October 13, 2015 Congrats to Henry Ruggs III on receiving an offer from the University of Cincinnati. #Bearcats #Madhousefit pic.twitter.com/bK0EroSK0v — Madhouse Training (@Madhousefit) October 13, 2015 Read or Share this story: http://on.mgmadv.com/1RKpQlf Most Popular
